data.author: Pablo Garrido
data.message:
Support for service clients (#44)

* added client, service guard_condition variables to executor_handle

* typo

* replaced PRINT_RCLC_ERROR with PRINT_RCLC_WARN in those cases where calling the fini-method and trying to free memory multiple times, this solves also the [ERROR] output in the output of colcon_test for the test cases with these errors.

* added rclc_executor_add_service and rclc_executor_add_client functions with unit tests.

* updated UNUSED macro to RCLC_UNUSED

* baseline service/client support - added header/source files for client and service

* added new files for client service

* added unit tests for client and service

* corrected ament_uncrustify for example_lifecycle_node.c

* added unit test 'executor_test_service' which tests if a request from a client is received by executor and the corresponding callback is called

* implementation for service and client in executor finished. (service unit test: OK, client unit test: FAILED

* Client/Service support finished. unit test OK

Signed-off-by: Staschulat Jan <jan.staschulat@de.bosch.com>

* Update rclc/include/rclc/client.h

Co-authored-by: Ralph Lange <ralph-lange@users.noreply.github.com>

* Update rclc/include/rclc/client.h

Co-authored-by: Pablo Garrido <pablogs9@gmail.com>

* Update rclc/include/rclc/client.h

Co-authored-by: Pablo Garrido <pablogs9@gmail.com>

* Update rclc/include/rclc/client.h

Co-authored-by: Pablo Garrido <pablogs9@gmail.com>

* Update rclc/include/rclc/client.h

Co-authored-by: Pablo Garrido <pablogs9@gmail.com>

* update copyright notice

Co-authored-by: Ralph Lange <ralph-lange@users.noreply.github.com>

* change topic_name to service_name

Co-authored-by: Pablo Garrido <pablogs9@gmail.com>

* updated missing topic_name => service_name

* added argument checks for NULL (RCL_CHECK_ARGUMENT_FOR_NULL) for executor_add_service executor_add_client functions, updated unit tests.

* use union for all callbacks in executor_handle_t

* added example for service/client - runs, but sometimes an error message comes: [ERROR] [1605013436.369456148] [rclc]: [rclc_client_init_default] Error in rcl_client_init: client already initialized, or memory was unintialized, at /home/jst3si/ros2_try/src/ros2/rcl/rcl/src/rcl/client.c:74. Starting the client/service program again - solves the error. => needs to be looked at.

* resolved uninitialized client/service issue.

* updated copyright notice. updated repository link.

* updated package.xml to include example_interfaces.

* Added documentation about service/client example

* minor fixes.

* Updated copyright year.

* format changes in repo rclc_examples (ament_uncrustify)

* added support for guard_condition, unit test (test_executor.cpp TC executor_test_guard_condition) OK

* Added two service_callback types. one with one without request_id. unit test passed, example_service and example_client passed.

* Included rcl_get_initialized_service() and rcl_get_initialiezed_client() in rclc_init_service() and rclc_init_client() resp. This simplifies creation of the object. User does not have to call this function. unit test passed, example in rclc_examples passed.

Signed-off-by: Staschulat Jan <jan.staschulat@de.bosch.com>

* resolved typo.

Signed-off-by: Staschulat Jan <jan.staschulat@de.bosch.com>

data.author: Staschulat Jan
data.message:
Backport for ROS 2 version Dashing and Eloquent.
One function of rcl_wait needs to be included.

Test code:
Directory workspace contains cloned rclc repository.

cd workspace
source /opt/ros/dashing/setup.bash
colcon_build --packages-up-to rclc_examples
source ./install/local_setup.bash
ros2 run rclc_examples example_executor_convenience

rm -rf build install log
exit
(create new terminal)
source /opt/ros/eloquent/setup.bash
colcon_build --packages-up-to rclc_examples
source ./install/local_setup.bash
ros2 run rclc_examples example_executor_convenience

Signed-off-by: Staschulat Jan <jan.staschulat@de.bosch.com>

data.message:
rclc: updated unit tests - in come cases it was assumed with the option 'ALWAYS', that the callback is called for every invocation of spin_some or spin_period. This is not the case with the default trigger condition ANY, which only executes the registered callbacks, if new data for at least one handle is available. Solution: new trigger condition ALWAYS, which always returns true.

data.author: Staschulat Jan
data.message:
Example with trigger condition. One executor with two publishers (r1=1Hz r2=0,5Hz) one executor with two subscribers. Trigger function a) when both messages are received (AND logic) b) when either message is received (OR logic). With subscriptions_options.qos.depth=0 (register semantic at DDS queue) the output is a) message reveived with slower rate and intermediate message are lost b) all message are received
